result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Lee Childs

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Joseph Lee Childs in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Joseph Lee Childs.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and traffic matter. Pleads not guilty to traffic. Court accepts plea, will trail with criminal matter. State calls witness  Elijah Newton, Deputy Sheriff, Douglas County Sheriff's office. Witness sworn and testified. State-direct examination of witness. October 29, 2022, City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin. Witness identifies Defendant. Record reflects identification.  Attorney Hoffman cross examines witness.  Exhibits 1 and 2 marked. State submits Exhibits 1 and 2, moves to be received. No objection. Court receives exhibits. State rests.
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney Hoffman makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms they have received date and time of hearing and confirms they will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon including firearms.

1:40 PM Defendant Joseph Lee Childs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Hoffman makes special appearance. Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified. Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Attorney acknowledges complaint, waives reding, pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea. 
State requests $10,000 cash, with conditions of no driving without valid license or permit, no use or possession of drugs, no firearms. Cites fairly lengthy record. Currently in warrant in Ashland County. Cites prior FTA's. Also has a Bayfield county matter with several FTA's. Several Minneota convictions and probation violations.
Attorney Hoffman questions defendant. Can post $500.
Court makes statements. Court orders $6,000 cash, with conditions of no driving without valid license or permit, no use of drugs, no use of dangerous weapons including firearms. 
Defendant will apply for public defender. .
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
